heading: Question 1
text: (4 marks)find equation line need find gradient.can find gradient tangent curve?Differentiate substitute \(x=\) find gradient tangent.Next just need know point tangent passes .can find \(y\)-coordinate corresponds \(x=2\)?Substitute \(x=2\) \(y=x^3-2x^2+5\) find corresponding \(y\)-coordinate.Use coordinate together gradient found straight line equation \(y-b=m(x-)\).\(y=4x-3\)

heading: Question 2
text: (4 marks)properties perpendicular bisector?Start finding gradient line AB.gradient perpendicular bisector?gradient perpendicular line AB, find midpoint AB.coordinate perpendicular gradient can used \(y-b=m(x-)\).\(3y=-4x+41\) \(y=-\dfrac{4}{3}x+\dfrac{41}{3}\)

heading: Question 3
text: (4 marks)One terms yet ready integrated.one? can rewritten?\(\dfrac{12}{x^2}\) can written \(12x^{-2}\).rule integrating increase power one divide new power.answer indefinite integration include?Dividing \(\dfrac{3}{2}\) multiplying \(\dfrac{2}{3}\).Remember simplify part much possible include "\(+\mathrm{C}\)".\(-12x^{-1}+\dfrac{2}{3}x^{\frac{3}{2}}+\mathrm{C}\)

heading: Question 4
text: (3 marks)three log laws?must applied first ?Use power law \(y\log_ax=\log_ax^y\) remove \(2\) front first log.Next, happens logs added?Remember \(3^{-1}=\dfrac{1}{3}\).therefore value \(\log_3{\left(\frac{1}{3}\right)}\)?\(-1\)

heading: Question 5
text: (2 marks)graph transformations question.transformation \(f(-x)\dots\) ?transformation \(f(\dots)+3\) ?Write three coordinates given graph \(y=f(x)\).\(f(-x)\dots\) "flips" \(x\)-coordinates.\(f(\dots)+3\) adds \(3\) \(y\)-coordinates.Write three transformed coordinates.three coordinates \((-4,3\), \((0,6)\) \((2,3)\).Use sketch graph "flipped horizontally" shifted \(3\).

heading: Question 6
text: (4 marks)diagram shows angle \(q\) questions ask \(2Q\).can \(\sin{2q}\) \(\cos{2q}\) expanded?length right-angled triangle's hypotenuse needed question.Use \(\sin{2q}=2\sin{q}\cos{q}\) \(\cos{2q}=2\cos^2{q}-1\).length hypotenuse \(\sqrt{5^2+1^2}\).triangle, write values \(\sin{q}\) \(\cos{q}\).Substitute values \(\sin{q}=\dfrac{1}{\sqrt{26}}\) \(\cos{q}=\dfrac{5}{\sqrt{26}}\).simplify.\(\sin{2q}=\dfrac{5}{13}\) \(\cos{2q}=\dfrac{12}{13}\)(3 marks)can \(\sin{(2q-r)}\) expanded?Use \(\sin{(2q-r)}=\sin{2q}\cos{r}-\cos{2q}\sin{r}\).values \(\sin{2q}\) \(\cos{2q}\) already found part ().values \(\sin{r}\) \(\cos{r}\)?Substitute \(\sin{r}=\dfrac{1}{\sqrt{17}}\) \(\cos{r}=\dfrac{4}{\sqrt{17}}\) expanded form.\(\dfrac{8}{13\sqrt{17}}\)
